newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold trade quiet on firm prices.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold trade quiet on firm prices.

text.p: Istanbul gold exchange volume tumbled to 627 kilos on Monday, from Friday's 1,123 kilos on continuing firm prices and lack of physical demand, dealers said.
Gold closed unchanged in dollar terms from Friday at $345.00 an ounce, but eased slightly in lira terms to 1,587,000 lira per gram, from 1,589,200 lira on Friday.

"The price levels we are seeing don't look as though they can be maintained for long. With the lack of physical demand coming from the free market as well, there wasn't much interest in the market today," one dealer said.
The Turkish lira eased slightly to 142,980 lira to the dollar from Friday's close of 142,960 lira.
Most of the the day's trade -- 517 kilos -- took place in the morning session with 80.9 percent of trade conducted in lira terms.
